channel.title: A new method of Loading objects
channel.description:
After playing around with BufferedWriter/Reader for awhile, I've devised a system to load objects from a text file.
-Loads Global Objects from a text file. -Optional description after the numbers (Use underscores for spaces) -Wrote a few commands to write a new object in the text file and reload the objects.
My main goal in this was: I hated having to restart my server everytime I wanted to just spawn a global object, they should be an easier way.
This is the syntax of the .txt file
2121 4918 2213 0 10 2121 4919 2213 0 10 test 2121 4920 2213 0 10 test_comment
My method parses the integers out and handles the comment if their is one.
A full tutorial on how to add this is located here: http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php?showtopic=14331

item.title: A new method of Loading objects
item.dc:creator: @guitars595 guitars595
item.description:
@guitars595 wrote:

Isn’t this pretty much a config file then? Because if it is, its already been done…

Read full topic

item.title: A new method of Loading objects
item.dc:creator: @Linksbro Linksbro
item.description:
@Linksbro wrote:

After playing around with BufferedWriter/Reader for awhile, I’ve devised a system to load objects from a text file.

-Loads Global Objects from a text file.
-Optional description after the numbers (Use underscores for spaces)
-Wrote a few commands to write a new object in the text file and reload the objects.

My main goal in this was: I hated having to restart my server everytime I wanted to just spawn a global object, they should be an easier way.

This is the syntax of the .txt file

2121 4918 2213 0 10
2121 4919 2213 0 10 test
2121 4920 2213 0 10 test_comment

My method parses the integers out and handles the comment if their is one.

A full tutorial on how to add this is located here:
http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php?showtopic=14331
